title: The Hobbit
description: This book is a critical introduction to J.R.R. Tolkien's The Hobbit, but it also advances an argument.

title: Demon Copperhead
description: A masterful recasting of David Copperfield, narrated by an Appalachian boy whose wise, unwavering voice.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality, told through the eyes of a child.
A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society under constant surveillance.

title: Pride and Prejudice
description: A classic romance novel about manners, upbringing, morality, and marriage.

title: The Great Gatsby
description: A critique of the American Dream set in the Roaring Twenties.

title: Moby Dick
description: The narrative of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to kill the white whale.

title: War and Peace
description: A sweeping chronicle of Russian society during the Napoleonic Era.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
description: A story about adolescent alienation and loss of innocence.

title: Brave New World
description: A futuristic society driven by technological advancements and loss of individuality.

title: The Lord of the Rings
description: An epic fantasy adventure in Middle-earth.

title: Jane Eyre
description: A coming-of-age story featuring a strong female protagonist.

title: The Alchemist
description: A philosophical novel about following your dreams.

title: The Book Thief
description: A young girl's relationship with books during WWII in Germany.

title: Crime and Punishment
description: A psychological drama about a man's moral dilemmas.

title: The Kite Runner
description: A story of friendship and redemption set in Afghanistan.

title: Animal Farm
description: A satirical allegory about a group of farm animals.

title: The Road
description: A bleak, post-apocalyptic journey of a father and son.

title: Wuthering Heights
description: A tale of passion and revenge on the Yorkshire moors.

title: Frankenstein
description: A gothic novel about a scientist who creates life.
